Package breakout.view

Class View

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • breakout.view.View
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class View
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Serves as the main view for Breakout. All other views will be within this one.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void createBoardView​(double[] ballCoordinates, double[] paddleCoordinates, int lives)
      This method creates the board and repaints the main view to make the board visible.
      void endGame​(double[] startingBallCoordinates, double[] startingPaddleCoordinates, int lives)
      Ends the game and adds several buttons: a save score button to save the score along with a username, a leaderboard button to look at the top 10 highest scores, and a play again button to play the game again.
      void playAgain​(double[] startingBallCoordinates, double[] startingPaddleCoordinates, int lives)
      Restarts the game again by removing the current BoardView and creating a new one.
      void resetGame​(double[] startingBall, double startingPaddle, int lives)
      Resets the game.
      void updateBoardView​(double paddleCoordinate)
      Updates BoardView's paddle coordinates.
      void updateBoardView​(double[] ballCoordinates)
      Updates BoardView's ball coordinates.
      void updateBoardView​(int row, int column)
      Updates BoardView's isBlockDestroyed and finalScore.
      void updateLeaderboardView​(Leaderboard scoreList)
      Updates the Leaderboard to include the newly added score.

    • Constructor Detail

      • View

        public View​(java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Message> queue)
        Constructs the main view of Breakout.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • createBoardView

        public void createBoardView​(double[] ballCoordinates,
                            double[] paddleCoordinates,
                            int lives)
        This method creates the board and repaints the main view to make the board visible.
        Parameters:
        ballCoordinates - the coordinates of the ball
        paddleCoordinates - the coordinates of the paddle
        lives - the lives left which should be 3

      • updateBoardView

        public void updateBoardView​(double paddleCoordinate)
        Updates BoardView's paddle coordinates.
        Parameters:
        paddleCoordinate - the new paddle coordinates

      • updateBoardView

        public void updateBoardView​(double[] ballCoordinates)
        Updates BoardView's ball coordinates.
        Parameters:
        ballCoordinates - the new ball coordinates

      • updateBoardView

        public void updateBoardView​(int row,
                            int column)
        Updates BoardView's isBlockDestroyed and finalScore.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the block to destroy
        column - the column of the block to destroy

      • resetGame

        public void resetGame​(double[] startingBall,
                      double startingPaddle,
                      int lives)
        Resets the game. This is not restarting the game, but just puts the paddle and ball in the starting position without resetting the blocks or lives.
        Parameters:
        startingBall - the starting ball position
        startingPaddle - the starting paddle position
        lives - the current remaining lives

      • endGame

        public void endGame​(double[] startingBallCoordinates,
                    double[] startingPaddleCoordinates,
                    int lives)
        Ends the game and adds several buttons: a save score button to save the score along with a username, a leaderboard button to look at the top 10 highest scores, and a play again button to play the game again.
        Parameters:
        startingBallCoordinates - the starting ball coordinates when game is restarted
        startingPaddleCoordinates - starting paddle coordinates when game is restarted
        lives - the lives at the end of the game which should be 0 since the game has ended

      • playAgain

        public void playAgain​(double[] startingBallCoordinates,
                      double[] startingPaddleCoordinates,
                      int lives)
        Restarts the game again by removing the current BoardView and creating a new one.
        Parameters:
        startingBallCoordinates - the starting ball coordinates
        startingPaddleCoordinates - the starting paddle coordinates
        lives - the lives remaining which should be 3

      • updateLeaderboardView

        public void updateLeaderboardView​(Leaderboard scoreList)
        Updates the Leaderboard to include the newly added score.
        Parameters:
        scoreList - holds the list of scores
